title.narrative: 5.3 STAFF SALARIES

description.narrative: Human Resources Capacities available for PESP effectiveness, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more disadvantaged and excluded children are benefiting from an improved policy environment and strengthened social protection system

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Human Resources Capacities available for PESP effectiveness

description.narrative: UNICEF social policy;programme;and planning monitoring and evaluation functions in Sudan are designed, implemented and monitored by a high caliber of staff and consultants deployed in the main office in Khartoum and in 6 field offices and 5 sub-offices across Sudan. 15 staff members and 13 UN volunteers are currently onboard within the social policy and planning, monitoring and evaluation sections.;Diverse and changing needs in the country required a team of diverse backgrounds. 14 out of the staff and UNVs members are female (50%).; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022
